channel.title: [PI] How to restict login name creation?
channel.description:
I was currently wonding weither it was possible to filter character creation process in PI so that people can not make false accounts pretending to be staff members.
I would like to make it so that normal people cannot create an account that has "Mod " in the beginning. If anyone has any idea's or suggestions could you please leave a responce.

item.title: [PI] How to restict login name creation?
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

where the return codes are sent.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] How to restict login name creation?

were would you add the code just anywhere in the file?

item.source: [PI] How to restict login name creation?

item.title: [PI] How to restict login name creation?
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

if the player name contains mod and the users’ player rights are equal to zero it will return and not allow you to make the account.

That’s all you need. Everything in what he said is there.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How to restict login name creation?

item.title: [PI] How to restict login name creation?
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

if (playerName.contains("mod") && playerRights == 0) { return; }

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Er they do have a way to. Though I don’t know how. It’s somewhere within the new account log in stuff. If anything, it might be client sided. But I do remember it being possible.
It would kind of be like an anti SYI check. but with a different name.
